> 
> It is not clear to me if this article is aimed at=
 JUnit development, or

veloped with

ds:

> BecauseItMustBeDiff=
erentThanTheUsername()

The main idea is when=
 behavior methods perform their logic independent
of other behavior methods=
 they are more likely to be used, tested, and
understood correctly.  For a =
given set of data (state), the behavior
methods should return the correct a=
nswer regardless of what order they
were called in.  Does that clarify Habi=
t 5?
